name: Castle Crashers®
description: Hack, slash, and smash your way to victory in this award winning 2D arcade adventure from The Behemoth!
minimum_requirements: OS:Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / 7 /  Processor:Intel Core 2 Duo 2GHz+ or better Memory:1 GB RAM Graphics:256 MB video card DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:255 MB HD space Sound:DirectX compatible Other Requirements:Broadband Internet connection Additional:Supports Microsoft® Xbox 360 controller or Direct Input compatible controller         Additional:Ultra Graphics Mode requires a 64-bit OS, at least 4GB of RAM, and a 2GB VRAM.

reviews.review_text: Played it on the Xbox, played it on PC and still love it.    Best played with friends!!
Got beheaded so that my friend could get laid.   10/10 would wingman again.

Like my pre-teen kid when she's hopped up on Mountain Dew and Skittles, Castle Crashers is completely frenetic and has a penchant for toilet humor. And that's why we love it! The cartoonish graphics are great and there's little else more satisfying that to run around bludgeoning things indiscriminately . It's cheap, you'll have hours of fun.    Why aren't you playing already?
Behemoth is a solid game developer. Battleblock Theater and Castle Crashers are excellent representations of how games should be made. Funny, great and non-forced co-op, great stories and art design.

The best part of Castle Crashers is exploring the world - there are tons of levels that look and play completely differently. Though it can be done, single-player assaults are more frustrating and less enjoyable than teaming up with other people. The biggest issue in trying to take on levels solo is that multiple enemies can assault you with ranged attacks, making it difficult to even stand up before being knocked down again. Animal orbs are probably my favorite thing in Castle Crashers because they're just so damn cute.  PRESENTATION:  The story is straightforward and the game is easy to pick up and play.  GRAPHICS:  Everything is beautifully drawn and animated.  SOUND:  The digital, techno tunes are upbeat and perfect background music for raising hell.  GAMEPLAY:  Classic side-scrolling brawler gameplay mixed up with fun boosts and magic makes for a great time with friends. Slightly busted multiplayer is a downer though.  LASTING APPEAL:  The campaign is short, but there are multiple characters to unlock, lots of weapons and animals to unlock and 99 levels to max out, making it a game you can spend some serious time with.   Two other negatives:  The game is not worth the high price. Buy it on sale instead. It can be rather repetetive.  6/10
Honestly it's worth the $15, the gameplay is smooth (if not a little short) the story is enjoyable and all around it's a great stress relieving Beat 'em up.

Do you like arcade games? Maybe you wanted to try some but you've never had a chance or you don't want to waste time with emulators? If YES is an answer to any of these you should totally check Castle Crashers! Humoristic, pretty and friendly arcade game here on steam. Perfect for playing with a group of friends or your siblings.  What's so cool about Castle Crashers? • Nice cartoon graphics. • Even decent plot. • Lots of funny moments. • Tons of characters to unlock, each one with thier own 'magic'. • Lotsa swords and weapons. • Pet companions. • Interesting sceneries. • With a friend to join your game, the fun is doubled.  There are few disadvantages tho; • 12€ is not so cheap as for indie arcade game.  • Playing alone is not as fun as with friends. • You will need a controller if you want to play on one PC.  Other than that Castle Crashers is one ♥♥♥♥ good arcade game worth your time if you like the genre. I honestly recommend it.  -  D.Punk

Introduction:  Castle Crashers is a 2D hack and slash adventure game set in a cartoonish medieval world of knights, princesses and  dragons  pooping animals. Your only goal is to rescue the four distressed princesses from formidable foes and earn their kisses as a reward. This game is best played with two to three other friends, a controller, and a box of pizza to share.   Pros:  -Over 30 unique characters and dozens of weapons to unlock and choose from. -Cheap DLC characters with proceeds going to charity. -Can be played on keyboard or a controller. -Wonderful cartoonish graphics and easy-to-learn gameplay. -Constant action and a simple levelling system. -Crude humour with poop jokes.   Cons:  -Game can get boring and repetitive after completion with multiple characters. -Lacks a high number of achievements for achievement-loving gamers.   Overall:  Castle Crashers is a fun game to play with friends and is a must-buy when on sale. It is simple and provides constant action throughout the story. Beating the game with certain characters unlocks other unique characters that all have their own pros and cons. With so many weapons, pets and characters to choose from, Castle Clashers is surely an enjoyable classic. My rating would be an 8/10.

It's a 4 Player medival Beat-em-up set in a comedic medival setting, let's get this out of the way, it's a port from XBLA, meaning it WILL tell you the XBOX controlls, and it WILL tell you to use a controller. The game is fun, but since there are only 2 attack buttons it gets redundant fast. Much like with borderlands 2, the story is just too repetitive and they have too many characters to play it as. I guarantee you 1 playthrough of this should be enough to quench your thirst. I'm not saying it's a bad game, the thing about it is just that the only replay value it has is with it's 3000 extra characters, but think about that, would you want to sit at your computer for hours a day as each character trying to get them to level 99? of course not. The game is good though, and it does have some minigames, but expect to lose at them. i give it a 6.5/10.

The game also provides a great multiplayer experience with up to 4 players who can engage to the main campaign which comes in two difficulty flavors or duke it out in a arena type PvP style mode. Play as different types of characters with their own magic style, it's pretty a lot of great humor added throughout the game and Nostalgic Beat Em Up Genre and finally.. Decent plotline. Overall! It's a great Indie game Beat Em Up that contains with RPG and Action, i recommend this game for people who are interested with Beat Em Up and Hack and RPG with Action.  Rated: 9.3/10

Played it for many hours at first on Xbox 360 and some time after, at some sale, started to play it again on PC. I can say for sure that Castle Crashers is one of most interesting beat 'em up games I have ever played. Graphics might look like some kind of game for kind but don't be mistaken - kids, teenagers, adults, everyone will have great time playing this game. With so many characters (few at start, many to unlock) to play, so many levels to make, many weapons and secrets to find, you won't be bored after beating once, or twice, or until you will reach max level with every character. You can enjoy it alone, or with friends on 1 PC or over internet. Castle Crashers isn't not only filled with action, but also with humour, and what's better, the one that will for sure make you laught, unless you take everything too serious. Sure, some people will say it get's boring quickly or it's repetitive but if you ask me, I didn't get bored even once in those 50 (at the moment I'm making this review) hours. And I'm sure I will play it at some point again, and again, and again... and again. It's really easy to get addicted to this game.  In my opinion, it's worth full price but sure, there are people who might not know what Castle Crashers is, or what kind of people made this game. If you are fan of beat 'em up games, then you must grab it at sale. Look at the number of reviews this game have received, and look at what number of those are positives ones - there is high chance that another positive review will be coming from you.

The game also has some RPG elements to add some depth to it. Playing by yourself is fun, but when you play with others it is a great adventure. I highly recommend getting this game. The game is fun - especially with friends! So don't think I don't like this game. It's got a hefty amount of clever jokes that aren't too far shoved in your face (like I noticed Ceiling Cat watching me from above in the pet store). But the controls for this game are... to put it gently... relatively poor.  It recommends an Xbox controller, but it's a PC game so it should assume the majority of people will play it using a mouse and keyboard. It translates it's controls as though you're using an Xbox controller first off - something that was a really bad sign to me at first - but the real thing that crimps the controls is the fact you have to hold some buttons and tap others to activate this or that action. Your starting spell for instance is simply 'Hold Shift, press Strong-Attack' while the bolt version of it would be 'Hold Shift, Press Use-Item'. Even then to cast spells in the air you have to use different buttons (Strong-Attack or Use-Item) to decide if you shoot horizontally or downwards which is just feels off (why not just let the movement keys press the direction you want to aim?). The fact that you can't even seperate the Item, magic, and the melee commands makes it bug♥♥♥♥ disorienting.   It's a keyboard: It has enough buttons to cover the actions without having to resort to playing Twister with your fingers.  That said I can't say I've played it and not had a blast yet. Granted I've only been playing it a couple of days so far.  It's by no means an easy game, but it's a fun one.

I am not the person who decides on the games that you play, you are!  Personally, I would highly recommend this game. However, it does have some flaws to it... Let's start with the good stuff: > The game has an amazing soundtrack (And yes, I do know that the music was made by waterflame) > Great concept, but not very original > Lots of characters with different spells to suit your play style > The game has two DLC's: Pink Knight and The BlackSmith heroes  Now lets go onto the bad stuff: > The game seems very grindy, meaning that if you want to be able to play this game you are going to have to spend your skill points wisely and after a certain amount of levels instead of getting 2 skill points you only get 11, meaning that you have to grind more. > Even though the game has two DLC's, I would not recommend to you that you should buy these because each of the heroes have magic to use against their foes. However the Pink Knight's and the BlackSmith's magic are just re skins of the original magic attacks. With the Pink Knight shooting rainbow's and stuffes animals and the BlackSmith have the armoury frog and a Hammer to throw. > The DLC's do come with weapon's suck as the lollipop for the Pink Knight and the hammer with antlers for the Black Smith, but honestly, these weapons aren't even top tier weapons, I guess the lollipop is good with it's huge agility bonus, but agility isn't one of those skills that you woud want to devote your skill points into when you could actually be putting skill points into magic by using another weapon so that you can explore the DLC's spells. > Final point for the DLC heroes weapon's is that if you have completed the game before, it's just going to be the same story meaning that you are probably going to have quite a few pets and very high tier weapons, so even though you have your DLC weapon, there are still weapons that are going to be much better. > When this game says that they recommend a controller THEY MEAN IT! Personally I found the keyboard controlls extremely uncomfortable so I changed them to the Dota 2 ability shortcuts.  But so yeah, that's a review that I hope will enlighten some of you who actually bother to read this review when there's probably a much better review out there...

This is a fun side scrolling RPG with a button combo fighting style. It is incredibly addicting, especially when played with others. A caution to solo play, it is quite often that you will get 'stunlocked'. You can do this to enemies, and it's funny in multiplayer to just bounce an enemy back and forth between two players. Sadly, it works the other way. A good example is already before the second big boss, which is a giant catfish. This weird hairy creature keeps spawning minions, and a LOT of them. Multiplayer works best because one player can focus on the boss and the others can deal with the minions. In singleplayer, if the minions are let to spawn constantly, the player is swarmed. Not saying that it's the game's fault that you let the enemies spawn in, but without sheer luck and button mashing, the enemies will stunlock you to oblivion and kill you instantly, which is stupid.  I do not recommend playing this game on your own if you do not know what you are doing.

So I Woke Up This morning thinking, hey i want to review a game today, so i did, and this time its the brave little indie game, Castle Crashers,[Sorry if it is not an indie game!] so its gonna be a real review for a real game, manly, SLIGHT SPOILER ALERT ABOUT THE START OF THE GAME!!! So the game starts off with the hero of the story, AKA The blue, red, orange or green knight, is dancing in the tavern in the kings castle, no king in particular just the king, but suddenly the door bursts open with a fellow grey knight falling down the stairs, the hero now proceeds up the stairs to find that the kings gem is being stolen by an evil wizard, again not an evil wizard in particular, just an evil wizard, the hero[s] proceed to chase after the evil wizard, while on the way to the wizard you are tasked with fighting barbarians, hooded figures and a minotaur ram that shoots CANONBALLS, AMAZING. Anyway before you can get to the wizard you encounter a GIANT barbarian called The Barbarian King, once defeated you have saved one of the 4 princesses, then you think to yourself, damn, this is gonna take a while Thus begins the epic 20 hour+ adventure around the small, but rich world of castle crashers!!! This is honestly one of my favourite indie/games of all time, but the things that i have wrong with it are the fact that this game has a HORENDUS pc port from xbox, binding the light attack button [x] to the actual button x and heavy atttack to y, except for that, it is amazing to get this game and i really recommend it to EVERYBODY because this game is amazing. 10/10 I ALWAYS DO 10S I KNOW

Castle Crashers was the game back then! It came out long ago, so I'll defend it, by mentioning the fact that the tools used now to create video games, compared to 'long ago', are just plain better.  That aside, that doesn't make CC any worse. CC is a great game. It had a great combat system, unique character magic, characters and weapons. The weapons are mainly cosmetics that change your stats. Aside from these facts, certain character magic abilities, such as the arrow storm, are used across a few of them. The boss fights are great to.  Insane mode exists to. I use the keyboard controls, they aren't bad, it's just people don't want to get used to it. Sure, I can 'Tornado juggle', 'Sand juggle', combine it, if thats the only way people will believe me, 'spellweave', etc. But let's be honest here. By joining random games, people never get the 'hint' to start a lvl 1 character, or play a character near your level. You won't progress if you don't play the exact mission your on, and theres no indicator for that in online play. You could, however, fight over what stage to pick.   That aside, a fair rating for this game, considering its release date and the like,   10/10.  There are 'NEW' games out there, in reality, most are just built on the same system of the previous. Those new games are what I call complete crap. They're all the same. At least, only a few aren't. And don't forget the RNG these days.

There's a lot of small complaints I could throw at Castle Crashers, but that's because I've played the game extensively on 3 PS3s and now my Steam copy that has 80+ hours logged. One is not likely to find much to bemoan during the first several playthroughs save for frequent short yet unskippable cutscenes which hamper the replay value. The Insane mode reeks of artifical difficulty and takes insanely LONGER than the regular game, and this port is missing the Volleyball mini-game from the PS3 version, as well as having no enhancements over any version, so when you see STEAM EDITION on the title screen, just... don't mind that.   Oh but the game offers many hours of gameplay and great combat mechanics. The levelling system is something I'd rather do without but I do like the abundant weaponry to collect.   This is especially a great multiplayer game, it's easy to pick up and pretty forgiving initially, and it's really cute.  My biggest complaint is that the 'hovercraft level' is ridiculously easy. So much so that it's a pain just to sit through.

I always remember wanting to play this game when I first saw it on XBLA. I eventually got the chance to do so, and I really did enjoy it. When I saw that it was on Steam, I of course had to plunk down another $15, and it was even more so worth it, since it visually looks better.  Castle Crashers is a sidescrolling hack 'n' slash beat 'em up. The game itself isn't TOO long, but with 4 players, and a 'Hard' mode (which is as close as you'll get to a New Game +), with several playable characters (that really aren't that different from one another, besides magic and appearence), and the ability to play this game with 3 other people (4 total, the way it was meant to be), there's quite a ton of replayability. Plus, the OST's fantastic, really some of Newgrounds' best.  If you're skeptical, maybe not worth $15, but if it's on sale, worth it all day.  6.5/10

In a nutshell this game is a 2D side-scrolling button masher littered with humorous and wtf moments. There are numerous RPG elements in the game, 3 stats to which you can pump points (Agility, Strength and Magic) A level up system and weapons you can find/ purchase. I would say the game is most fun in co-op, but whether you play co-op or single player the game will get boring after the 4th or 5th level as nothing is added to the gameplay. You have a normal attack, a heavy attack and a magic attack. Your magic attack is dependent on the character you selected at the start of the game and a lot of the time its not worth using at all. You can also block, jump and shoot arrows and... that's it, the level designs and boss fights can be interesting at times but most of the time you'll just be jumping and spamming attack regardless so it isn't enough to keep it interesting. I have no idea how this title won its awards, it certainly wasn't for the game-play.

This game has a bunch of things that I'm not a fan of. It's the sum of those makes me not reccommend this one.  First of all, really REALLY lousy keyboard support. I know they say these games should be played on a controller but that's just rubbish. I've never ever seen a game that wouldn't be totally playable on keyboard, until now perhaps, and that's just because of the laziness of developers. They didn't even bother replacing the controller button hints with keyboard ones!  Besides that, I can see the developers have put some effort on making this game not totally repetive random button smashing endless mass murder -simulator. They only got halfway there, as it is still basically repetive random button smashing endless mass murder -simulator, despite the fact that the mechanics do try to alternate from time to time. Also, the way they tried to implement depth in a 2D game makes landing your hits hard and the fact that in a 4-player co-op the screen gets full of stuff doesn't help either.  Lastly, the story is just another bad unimaginative 'save the helpless princess' -cliche combined with even worse and cheaper humour which is mostly pee-fart-poo-department.  On the other hand, maybe fighting games just aren't my cup of tea...

Beat Em Ups have a special place in my enlarged, Adderall-damaged heart. I used to play games like Double Dragon and River City Ransom to drown out the irritating sound of my ex-wife's damaged vocal chords as she attempted to crawl out of the meat freezer without her legs to call for help. But out of one of the darkest, dampest and most used tissue-ridden corners of the early 00's internet came a game that ♥♥♥♥ all over my retirement years: Castle Crashers. A Co-Op game slapped together in a weekend at the local  Gay Pride  Indie Game Development resort by a group of limp-wristed dweebs from  Newgrounds.com  in a desperate attempt to elevate the site as something more than a Sonic The Hedgehog H-Game breeding ground (They don't call him 'Knuckles' for nothing!)   Amazingly the developers somehow got away with releasing a flash game for an exorbitant amount of money. This game alone is $15 full price for a grand total of 5 hours of gameplay if you're not a stupid enough son of a ♥♥♥♥♥ to try and unlock all of the characters ( pro-tip: they're all reskins of each other ) and thats not counting the DLC to nickel and dime you with.   The game is a poorly-optimized PC port the likes of which would make even Arkham Knight blush. First thing it does is try to extort you into letting the dev's secret lover, Microsoft, shoot their poz-load into your wallet's neg-hole for a Controller, to the point where they couldn't be ♥♥♥♥♥ to draw symbols for actual Keyboard keys. Most of the fun of the game comes as you stumble about trying to figure out what the 360 buttons translate to with the convoluted Keyboard controls. If I wanted to use a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ controller I would've killed myself by now. But I guess when you're too busy pleasuring yourself with a realdoll of Super Meat Boy, its just too hard to adapt the UI for a different platform.   The gameplay is standard fare for a co-op Beat Em Up except you can level up your attack, defense, speed or special magic abillities. As well as there being a variety of weapons, most of which are ♥♥♥♥ing useless to create the illusion of content. After the third chapter of the game, the level designer and programmers must have gotten really sleepy from the half-♥♥♥♥♥ creation of the netcode for multiplayer and fell asleep at their computers, because soon you'll be saddled with hordes of the same enemies you have to hack at for hours to kill and lazy boss design that boils down to everyone being the same damage sponge. Not only this, you wind up with some gimmicky levels to break up the non-existent pacing. The one thing I think we can all agree on is that all Beat Em Ups need a self-destruct sequence where you have to avoid hitstun obstacles under an extremely short time limit to complete the level; one ♥♥♥♥ up and you're done.   But where I personally believe this game shines is the HILARIOUS and QUIRKY humor that only Newgrounds users could deliver. For instance, in the second level you're being followed by a giant Troll monster that shakes the earth with every step. What better way to show off the comedic chops of the developers than to make every animal you encounter ♥♥♥♥ themselves profusely at the sight of the monster, to the point where they propel across the environment. And to make sure you've noticed this shining example of Video Game humor, they do this four different times throughout the level; a textbook example and fair warning of what to expect from the rest of the game.  After another 19 levels of slow, monotonous trash you finally reach your final destination: the lair of the Dark Wizard himself (rumors say that Tom Fulp likes to call himself this as he's animating his fantasies of finally beating up his dad set to Linkin Park on the Newgrounds flash portal). But before you can finally be free from this mortal coil, why don't you do some more completely 'UNIQUE and VARIED'   [Citation Needed]   boss battles? By this point I was already in cardiac arrest because this was so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ boring, but the hospital staff was kind enough to replace my heart monitor screen with the game so I could finally finish it- this time pumped up full of morphine to dull the suicidal thoughts. It was no surprise that the developers simply gave up because the final boss is one of the generic mooks you were beating on at the start of the level. After another lame boss fight and credit roll you get to the true ending. Think you're going to get the princess, live happily ever after, and apply for a refund on Steam? Nope. You're just treated to a prime example of why middle aged men should never try to be 'hip with the cool kids' on the internet. The cringe-inducing 'wackiness' and 'quirkiness' of the ending put me into a 6-month coma from which the doctors never expected me to recover, and I still can't feel the left side of my face.   4/10 : Let's just say they never made a Castle Crashers 2 for a reason.

Now I saw that it was on sale and I though 'Hell, why not? It's really cheap anyways!'  So I bought it, I installed it and I played it for 30 minutes. And I really repent not buying this game years ago. It's really fun to play even on your own and, even though it's an old game, with 2D graphics and everything, it keeps you glued to your PC screen while playing it.  That is to say that you don't need 10/10 realistic graphics, complicated controls and all that to have fun. And Castle Crashers is the perfect exemple of this. Even though it's not my kind of game... usually, I don't find this to be a bad game. Castle Crashers is a game that fits snug in the casual/party genre. I can confidently say that I don't like party games, I really don't. I could go on a long tirade on why I dislike party games but this isn't the place for that.   Really, it isn't a bad game at all. Anyone who launches this game off of Steam can see this is the product of the hard work and creativity of very skilled developers. This is a game that accomplishes exactly what it sets out to be. Castle Crashers doesn't have the gameplay depth of chess or the storytelling depth of Animal Farm because it would go against the very foundation it stands for.  Castle Crashers can be summed up simply by two words: DUMB FUN.  And despite my distaste for the genre itself I do find myself drawn to the game from time to time. Sometimes I just want to mash the buttons on my fightstick instead of performing intricate combos or dodging bullets. Really it's best played in periods of 20 minutes at a time or in social situations. There isn't enough gameplay depth to play for hours on end. Mashing three buttons gets reptitive after a while. And that's perfectly allright because obviously plenty of casual gamers have been enjoying gaming in short bursts, sneaking in a game or two before going back to work.

So, I have owned and played Castle Crashers on Steam for around 8 hours so far. But, on my Xbox I played for a lot longer and have had a lot more experience with this game. And I have to tell you, I absolutely love this game and everything it brings to the world it has created. This game at its core is a side-scrolling hack and slash adventure with distinctive graphics and an amazing soundtrack. Its gameplay was well created, keeping the game fresh feeling throughout, It has a simple leveling system that actually changes your experience with the different strategies you use to level skills, and the level design is entertaining and makes you feel like actual progression is made, rather than feeling like you have been in the same area for the entire game. I also read what others said about this game to get a feel for how many other casual gamers see the game. Many feel that the lack of voice recording or story makes this game just short of perfect. I could understand how this could be a legitimate concern for many but, I can try to explain why it is not such a bad thing. This is a definate party game that you would sit down with 3 other friends with and play. Many games that are developed like this do not have open and rich lore that can be explored and cherished. This game being one of them, instead gave the game a 'Save the Princess!' type of story that does well with the kind of game this is. Voice acting though usually goes hand in hand with story progression. This game could have used some sort of voice acting to give the game depth and more relatable characters, but whoes gonna relate to blood thirsty knights who have killed hundreds of enemies and friends for a simple kiss from a princess? That's why I feel the games story is unimportant, because the game made itself to rather be a more fun and entertaining multiplayer game, rather than a long and eventful epic that indulges the player in its characters and story. Of course all of this is opinionated to specific people so I'll let you decide if you want to buy the game or not.  10/10

I toyed with him, dodging his laser shots and laughing, stepping closer and closer to murder the final man of the wave. Something happened, he stopped shooting and we had a moment of silence staring at eachother. Maybe he had a revelation and was going to tell this story as a survivor and change his planet's philosophy on galactic domination. I wanted my story to carry on so I allowed him to live. I bought the 4-pack so I can play with my friends (which is the only way you'll really have fun) and I never, erver regretted my decision. The story was magnificant, never-ending (at least thats how it felt) and always changing so you'll never get bored. It also had minigames such as all you can quaff and the arena which will get your competitive side showing against your friends. There are a huge variety of characters as you progress but the starting collection is limited, which is one downside. I also got annoyed that the game isnt made for keyboard controls and the keyboard controls it already has are just plain terrible, so you'll have to cutomize it (and memorize it because it show Xbox controls n the screen). But, hey, if you have an Xbox controller and you like it, that's a huge bonus for you! So overall it's an amazing game that can entertain you for weeks or even months!

BE WARNED: The game starts with a message 'We recommend you use a controller', but keep in mind it meant 'You better have one otherwise screw you!'.  I don't know if it is a bug or an option (which in this case probably should be automatic, then), but what happens is the game still thinks it is being run in an xbox and thinks that you'll figure things out by pressing all your keys, which is easy to figure out on a console but on a keyboard you happen to have about 105.  Some are based on classic games like arrows, enter, and when you try WASD you figure out that A shoots arrows and D hits stuff, but then when combos start to pop up saying 'B+X' it shows its religious tendencies and put your guesses in the good hands of God.  Couldn't play much yet because now I have to buy the damn thing to keep up with my friends which is a shame because it is an otherwise (as far as I saw) a fun game. But I can not recommend.

This game has been pretty damn enjoyable. I was lucky enough to get it on sale for $1.50 and at that price it's probably the most worthwhile purchase I've made in a long time. Hours of fun throwback sidescrolling hack'n'slash mechanics with a ton of weapons and weird animal ball things that subtley but clearly change the gameplay.   Complaints  Cutscenes aren't skippable. It's 20-♥♥♥♥ing-15. We don't need to watch the same cutscene over and over again. When one of the draws of your game is eighty bajillion playable characters it's a pain in the ♥♥♥ to see the same cutscenes over and over with no option to press a button to get back to the fun.  That's it really. I personally wouldn't have paid $15 for it in the first place but now that I've played for a while I'd say it's probably worth it. Wait for it to go on sale again if you're unsure.
Very Good Game!

If you enjoy arcade-y fighting-game-esque side-scrollers you'll enjoy Castle Crashers. For its price it's worth it. Here's what I think.  + Very stylized, in all respects + Satisfying gameplay, can hold you long enough to want to beat it + Nice soundtrack + Different unlockables, making replayability a lot higher + Has some decent jokes, you will laugh AT LEAST once in a full play-through   - Boss battles are repetitive and annoying - Some enemies are OP - All controls are taught by controller, not by keyboard, making for some self-teaching if you play keyboard-mouse  Overall I really enjoy this game, and would recommend this game, but if you play on keyboard-mouse then learn the keybinds by heart, because everything is displayed by controller.  7.5/10 Would get stabbed, sawwed, shot, drowned, eaten, burnt and frozen again

So at this point, You've probably played this game atleast once. On PC, or on Xbox. I hope...  This game is a beautiful 2nd part of the Behemoth games series. For a game that came out a few years back. This would count as a steam classic for me. The story is simple. Your a knight. The princesses have been kidnapped. Save them. It's simple, but it does a really good job in making the story part of the game. Every time you beat a certain boss, you get one of the 4 princesses. It's more of a reward since you can basically go all in by just kissing the princess after beating the boss. I like the gameplay and the story.  Multiplayer? It's alright. There are two options when you go into multiplayer; All you can eat, and Story mode (Co-Op Online.) Now multi player online isnt really good since most people just play single player. So your better off just having a friend on steam play with you.  That kind of covers it. There are Characters. They are mostly the same thing but they have different specials. They have weapons that you find throughout the game, but it really dosnt do much since the game gets harder as it goes on so in the end it dosnt really change much.  So lets see the ups. (Story/Gameplay/Multiplayer1/2.) Thats a solid 9.5 Now the downs.(Multiplayer1/2.) Thats mostly it... Thats minus 0.5  End Rating: 9  Letter rating: A+  This game is a pure classic. It does alot of things right for a game that came out 7 years ago.(If your reading this in 2016, 8 years.) This game is highly recommended from me and, I hope you have fun playing this game if you end up buying it. And I hope you dont regret it! Cheers!  ~Mabel

So I got Battleblock Theater before this. I already knew Behemoth was an amazing game developer. They kept up their game (no pun intended). This game is much better. I don't know how they did it. This is their first game. And they nailed it. All the unlocks, all the magic, all the bosses, everything. It may seem kind of layerless(physically and storywise), but it isn't. It has a huge amount of depth. The Blacksmith alone is an amazing place. You have a sullen purple knight with antlers banging out swords on the anvil. Then you have a frog with antlers with its mouth open. You walk in the mouth and you see every single weapon for sale inside of the frog. It's interesting to say the least. Also, if you own Battleblock Theater, you can play as Hatty. Same way around in Battleblock. You can play as a knight. So really, just have as much fun as possible, which is a lot.

I also own this game on xbox.  This is a great game to play when you want to play something that doesn't require too much thinking. It's a very well done old school beat-em-up.   Here are some things I like about the game:  1: Cool art style. 2: Fluid and easy to use controls. 3: Stat progression that is simple and makes sense. 4: Tons of weapons that have different stat boosts. 5: Tons of pets that each offer different perks. 6: Quite a few unlockable characters. Each have unique magic attacks. 7: Online 4 player co-op which is a blast.  You won't regret buying this game. Don't expect anything too deep or innovative, just an easy game to pick up and play game that will suck you in for hours at a time.

If you liked Battleblock Theater, then you will surely like Castle Crashers.  Castle Crashers is a story about 4 princesses that ends up getting kidnapped as well as a powerful stone. Your role is a knight of the castle and you must fight your way through and defeat a boss to save a princess. There also stats which you upgrade by defeating a level and earning stat points. Make sure to choose wisely on how you upgrade your knight!  Pros: - It's fun and better with friends.  Cons: - Rage mode when you die.

Now I'm a fairly competitive guy, but this game bring out the true nature of myself. Even though this is a co-operative game, I find myself fighting more against my friends I'm playing with than the actually things we're trying to kill. And I couldn't enjoy it more. You would think that killing basically the same enemy over and over would get boring, but it doesn't. Ever. The character progression is simple but effective all the same, and the character selection is chalk full of lots of different choices that make surprisingly big differences. Even without the DLC classes, there are lots of choices (once you beat the game to unlock them). My friends and I are big proponents for the couch co-op genre, though it seems to be a dying breed these days. Castle Crashers is a staple of the casual couch co-op that I grew up loving. Some people complain that the $15 price tag is too much for a sidescroller with repetitve gameplay, but they couldn't be mroe wrong. In the short time that I've actually played it, I already feel like I've gotten more than my money's worth.  It's easy to pick up, can occupy you for five minutes or five hours, and will have you chuckling to yourself the whole time. What more do you want? (probably something but let's be honest, you're just nitpicking now)

Pros & Cons  Pros:   Great, quick beat'em up   Perfect game to play with friends   Doesn't require a fast computer   Many functions to the game   Plenty of items to keep busy with getting   Challenging   Simple plot, with easy idea   Fun little minigames   Great amount of boss battles   Nice soundtrack   Can battle friends or 'randoms' in an arena   Best played with a controller   Cons:   Online multiplayer has no ranking system   After story, and gathering desired objects, game becomes dull   Many unlockable playable characters have very similar abilities   Positioning character to fight can be challenging   Online multiplayer allows everyone to have as much control as host   Difficult to use keyboard

Remember the ol' school days? The days where porting arcade button mashing action into your living room seemed impossible ...but then the unthinkable came through within a TMNT port to the NES. That was awesome! Except....uh.....well.....except the game took a serious hit in being ported. They watered down a lot of beauty to be able to port that game down.   Enter Castle Crashers on steam 20 years later and what do you have? Real arcade side scrolling beat 'em up action that is so beautifully drawn and rendered it will make your inner child reminisce of the days of yesteryear in which every saturday morning was a special day, full of cartoons, adventures, and video games! Want to bring that nostalgia back? Try Castle Crashers.

Castle Crashers takes you back to the classic Beat-Em-Up games. With a great leveling system, fluid combat, and an awesome cast of characters, this is a game you do not want to miss. Plus with 4 player co-op, local or online, this game is a blast with friends. Whenever you beat the game as a non-DLC character, you will unlock a new one with their own semi-unique magic to play through the game again. If you are looking for a good multiplayer beat-em-up, Castle Crashers is the way to go!

Now I'm a fairly competitive guy, but this game bring out the true nature of myself. Even though this is a co-operative game, I find myself fighting more against my friends I'm playing with than the actually things we're trying to kill. And I couldn't enjoy it more. You would think that killing basically the same enemy over and over would get boring, but it doesn't. Ever. The character progression is simple but effective all the same, and the character selection is chalk full of lots of different choices that make surprisingly big differences. Even without the DLC classes, there are lots of choices (once you beat the game to unlock them). My friends and I are big proponents for the couch co-op genre, though it seems to be a dying breed these days. Castle Crashers is a staple of the casual couch co-op that I grew up loving. Some people complain that the $15 price tag is too much for a sidescroller with repetitve gameplay, but they couldn't be mroe wrong. In the short time that I've actually played it, I already feel like I've gotten more than my money's worth.  It's easy to pick up, can occupy you for five minutes or five hours, and will have you chuckling to yourself the whole time. What more do you want? (probably something but let's be honest, you're just nitpicking now)

Castle Crashers overall was a really enjoyable game with an awesome soundtrack and some very well designed bosses. The game has quite a lot of characters to choose from at the beginning of the game and you can unlock even more characters as you progress in the game. Each character also has different special moves that you can use.   Once you complete the game you can go back to play any of the other levels again and still keep your characters level and weapons or you can attempt the insane mode if you want a harder challenge. One negative with the game is the fact that it can get quite repetitive playing on your own but if you were playing the game with friends it probably wouldn’t feel as repetitive at times.  Overall though i really enjoyed my playthrough of the game and will probably attempt the Insane Mode sometime

Ok....  So I felt I needed to give this game a decent shot before coming on Stream to review. Please also bear in mind when I purchased this game it was under £5.00 if my memory serves me correctly....  .....and I freakin love it!  For older gamers like me (35+) I would described Castle Crashers as a greatly improved version of Golden Axe. Obviously the old arcade classic was limited given it's release year was 1989, but it was still a whole lotta fun. You were pushing buttons frantically in a side-scrolling, beat 'em up, hack and slash fashion in order to save a damsel in distress.   Castle Crashers adopts this platform beautifully, and then some. The game allows you to build your character up as you earn XP from killing bad guys. The four areas of development are Strength, Magic, Defense and Agility. You can tailor the skills tree to your game style, and you can loot weaponry along the way to suit your style. If you would rather be a quick, nimble spell caster rather than a slugging but powerful tank then so be it. It's all a bit of fun anyway. Along the way you also collect coins from killing enemies, as well as stumbling across bags of gold, various jewels and mega rewards for slaying end bosses. There are sections along the way where you can spend your money on various items such as healing potions, weapons etc.  Another really cool element are the pets you befriend along the way. Depending upon the pet, it will aid you for the purpose it serves. For example the little bat you befriend gnaws the heads off your enemies along side you. The little seahorse allows you to travel through water more quickly. You can change your little buddies as and when you wish so long as there is another pet waiting to be loved.  You get to pick from a number of characters when you start your Castle Crashers quest, each character having a different type of magic to them. So far I have seen Ghostly Green Dust Cloud from the Green Dude, and a Thunderbolt from the Red dude. I haven't played long enough to check out the other characters.  In summary the game is a lot of fun. You can play solo or link up with friends via the multiplayer option. If you would rather just kick the crap out of people in an arena setting then you can do that! The main thing I have enjoyed thus far is the game's simplicity. They advise a joypad to play but I've had no problems with my keyboard. The game could have been a whole lot more finicky, with an overload of combos and moves, but what would be the point in having to learn all those stupid moved when all you really want to do is swing a spiked mace at someone.  I'm sure I have left out lots, but another outstanding feature in the game is it's humor. I'm not in the business of spoiling so you can find out for yourself, but there are definite moment where you can clearly see the designers were having a good old laugh.  Oh, and soundtrack is surprisingly good from fast Drum n Bass to trace like music you'd hear from Arabian Nights.  I will give it 7 out of 10. Great value and lots of fun.

I wrote a review a while back, but with the recent update it really needed rewritten.   I recommended it before and I'll recommend it again. Instead of being a simple console port, Castle Crashers is now a pretty damn good PC game. They upped the framerate cap to 60, increased texture resolution, added in keyboard button prompts that change automatically if you switch input methods, and possibly even increased screen resolution options, I'm not sure it supported 2560x1440 before, but it does now. It's awesome to see the game running this smooth and it's definitely worth a replay.  As far as gameplay, there's not much new from the previous version. There's a new (frustrating) game mode and 'All You Can Quaff' is gone. I'm pretty sure deleting that mini-game should be considered a feature. It was terrible. Otherwise, Castle Crasher is still as great of a co-op beat 'em up as ever.

920/1000  in 3 words, simple but great.  castle crashers is a VERY GOOD game, the COOP works fine, the combat is fluid, the graphics are SIMPLE and they allow you to play on any computer. I can't stop myself from playing this game, its meant to be played more than once. The story is short, FUNNY and very simple, it takes between 5 and 9 hours to finishs so if you get addicted you can go trough the game a dozen times just to unlock everything. at this point, i have played for 24 hours and have unlocked less than half the characters and still need to find some of the weapons. The fact that this game is made for coop, makes it even more fun, when you play with your friends (or even strangers), it makes this 2008 game just like a new one, its a lot more fun.  for those who like it hard it even brings an 'insane' mode to the table.  if there is any downside, it's that it gets repetitive the second time around.  pros  -great replay value -great coop -simple, funny and enjoyable story -fluid combat -lovely graphics -you can play this game years later and its still fresh.  cons  -repetitive (the second time and after only) -no depth to the story and world (but who cares, it's fun anyway)     920/1000

Castle Crashers is a fun 2D hack 'n' slash game that has you play as many different types of characters, including but not limitted to: The 4 Iconic Knights, A barbarian, A thief, and many others. Castle Crahers is a great game to play with friends on a shared screen. It is based in a silly medieval fantasy world where your goal is to save princesses from an evil magician. All that was done way before Aventure Time became popular.  It has an original style, with the vibe of older games made by the same developers, and a good sense of humour.  The fighting system is quite complex for a game of this genre and presents the players with a good variety of combos which increase in numbers with level progression. Friends of mine who were not used to games of this type usualy feel overwhelmed after a few levels.  The level progression adds an element that enhances the experience as an element of competion between the players. It allows players to upgrade different stats which unlock combos and abilities which gives options 'builds' for different playthroughs, although magic and melee weapon attack are always the best options to choose from. It is also fun to have different players focusing on a certain stat more than the others.  There is a choice of characters to play with which except for the visual style differ only in the types of spells they cast which can be very different from each other in terms of damage, area of effect and the effect itself. I found this more than enough to make want to play the game again as other characters.  A variety of weapons and consumables are also present, but they do not change the gameplay to a great extent. The absence of different bows other than the starting one is also disappointing,  There are a lot of different enemy types, some of which can be unlocked as player-controled characters which adds to the game's replayability.  The levels are numerous and with a different feel to most of them. One of the most pleasant surprises was how long the game was.  Definetely the best co-op side-scroller I have played and I have played a decent number of them.

I played the Xbox360 version of this game and had a great deal of fun with it, but the Steam version has a huge issue that needs to be addressed. It is a lazy port. All of the in game key prompts are for the 360 pad which means that if you don't have one you'll be out of luck, While the game is still playable with keyboard, it is an exercise in frustration as none of the ingame prompts are correct, and you can only find out the actual key configuration by looking in the menu and switching back and forth between the keyboard controls config and controller config. Every combo has to be practically translated in order to be used. The game claims to simply recommend the controller, but in reality punishes you if you don't use one. However, if you do have a 360 pad then you can just ignore everything I just said.  As for the game itself, it is remarkable. It is a simple yet quite enjoyable beat em up with a simple sense of humor that can delight (even if it is crude). The game was built with co-op in mind, and allows for both local and online play. There is a wealth of characters, weapons, and animal orbs (special followers that provide useful abilities or passive buffs) to unlock. the single player is fine on its own, and the game can be quite challenging without friends, but is far from unfair. If you do plan on playing with friends, it is recommended that the character you use be used solely for multiplayer with those friends, as the game is far more enjoyable when everyone is close in level. Of course, you start off with four different characters right off the bat, and unlock a number of others fairly quickly so there is plenty of room for experimentation before committing to a character.  All in all, if you have a 360 pad and so do your friends, then this is a great game to get, even at full price.

Castle Crashers, a 2D beat 'em up by the guys at Newgrounds, is an Xbox arcade classic. It's an easy going game that mixes stylized artwork, comedy, and fun yet simple gameplay mechanics. It is also a great multiplayer game to play with your friends, and I would definitely reccommend this game to anyone who is generally interested in video games.
